    public abstract class CollectionConverter<T extends java.util.Collection<?>>

    Converter implementation for converting to various kinds of collections

      • convertSpecial

        public T convertSpecial(java.lang.Object value,
               java.lang.Class<?> valueType,
               T def)
        Description copied from class: BasicConverter
        Called when a non-null and uncastable object needs to be converted. If such a thing is not supported, return def in the method body.

        This method needs to be implemented to satisfy the BasicConverter system. Null check and output assigning checks are already performed before this call.

        Specified by:
        convertSpecial in class BasicConverter<T extends java.util.Collection<?>>
        Parameters:
        value - to convert (not null and can not be cast to the output type)
        valueType - of the value
        def - to return on failure
        Returns:
        converted value, or def on failure
